questions.question: I ……………………….. something over there.
questions.description: We do not normally use the progressive forms of see when it means perceive with one’s eyes.

questions.question: ‘I have got a problem.’ ‘I ……………………….’
questions.description: I see can mean I understand.

questions.question: I ……………………….. the attorney tomorrow.
questions.description: When see means meet, progressive forms are possible.

questions.question: Suddenly I ………………………….. something absolutely marvelous.
questions.description: See can mean perceive with eyes.

questions.question: The boy ……………………….. the girl with eyes full of admiration.
questions.description: To look at something or somebody is to pay attention.

questions.question: ‘………………………….. the board.’
questions.description: Before an object, we use look at.

questions.question: Why are you ………………………….. me like that?
The police have been …………………………… him for a while.
I ………………………. a great movie yesterday.
questions.description: Watch and see are both used to talk about TV programs and films.

questions.question: …………………………. if that color suits you.
questions.description: See can be used in the sense of find out. It is followed by if/whether.
